_comment: Created by ianb on 27/04/2015 18:13:30 using v2.5
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of delayed days?
analysis_commentary: Trends in the number of delayed days are consistent with the trends in the number of patients delayed by organisation. The length of delays that patients are likely to experience when social care organisations are responsible for the delay has improved over time. However, the total number of delayed days accrued in a month when the delay is attributable to NHS organisations has increased by approximately 39% and by 35% when both organisations are responsible.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
